title: Wales coach Robin McBryde to stay at the Rugby World Cup despite the recent death of his mother
text:
Wales forwards coach Robin McBryde will remain with the team at the Rugby World Cup despite the death of his mother Diana.

McBryde was informed of the news prior to Wales' quarter-final win over France, the Welsh Rugby Union has confirmed.

McBryde said: 'I have received great support from the team and management out here and with the support from my family back home it allows me to remain in Japan.

Robin McBryde's mother sadly passed away last week whilst he was at the Rugby World Cup

'My mother was my biggest fan and as with any parent, she would want the best for me, so I know I am where she would want me to be.'

McBryde is expected to play a full part in preparations for Wales' World Cup semi-final against South Africa in Yokohama.

Head coach Warren Gatland said: 'The Wales squad, management and the whole of the Welsh Rugby Union would like to extend our heart-felt condolences to Robin and his family following the recent passing of his mother Diana.

'Robin is a proud family man and we as a squad are here to support him and his family in any way possible during this time.'

Wales are preparing for their World Cup semi-final with South Africa on Sunday.
description: McBryde was informed of the tragic news prior to Wales' quarter-final clash with France, the Welsh Rugby Union has confirmed. McBryde has praised the Welsh camp for their support.
